@AliceXiaoLu , Can you explain the issue you are trying to solve.  

Also, can you update the summary to read:  
```
[AMBARI-25154] can't delete Kerberos when user exits step 4 in enabling Kerberos wizard
```
If you are unfamiliar with the Ambari contribution process, please take a look at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/AMBARI/How+to+Contribute.

Team could you please review? @benyoka @zeroflag @g-boros @rlevas @kasakrisz 
Thanks!
@swagle I have added a test case - can you please review and merge it?
looks like these errors are not related to my changes.
retest this please

@payert , If the manual option is chosen, then Ambari is not managing the Kerberos identities. Therefore there is no need for Ambari to regenerate keytab files.  This is why the "Regenerate Keytabs" button is not available.   If it was available, then would would you want it to do?
retest this please
retest this please

I do not believe that this patch it really related to [AMBARI-25187](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMBARI-25187).  

@payert , Please indicate what part of that JIRA you think you are solving.

Test PASSed.

@rlevas , AMBARI-25187 states:
"The "Regenerate Keytabs" option should not be available to the user since Ambari is not managing Kerberos identities. The action doesn't do anything, but the user should not have the option to select it."

The patch removes the "Regenerate Keytabs" button (which was available) when Ambari is not managing Kerberos identities.

Now I am confused what the AMBARI-25187 is about, could you please elaborate ?
Thanks
@rlevas as far as I see, the issue here is that Regenerate button is still present even for manual kerberos, because it's handled incorrectly on UI side.

@aBabiichuk , thanks for the review. The `App.get('router.mainAdminKerberosController.isManualKerberos')` does not work here for some reason. Maybe `isManualKerberos` is not yet evaluated at this point.
retest this please

Test FAILured.
@payert `Em.computed.bool(...)` wouldn't work anyway, this is not the case where you should use computed property

> `Em.computed.bool(...)` wouldn't work anyway, this is not the case where you should use computed property
@aBabiichuk , thanks, what do you suggest then ?

@payert to use `App.get('router.mainAdminKerberosController.isManualKerberos')` or some other boolean (if any) which inducates if kerberos is manual or not, making sure that it's set correctly and that `App.HostComponentActionMap.getMap` is called after it's set

Hi @apappu ,

The Test is failing due to UT error after this code changes :

```
 900025 [ERROR] testFailedAuditMessage(org.apache.ambari.server.audit.LoginAuditEventTest)  Time elapsed: 0.351 s  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: 

Expected: "User(USER1), RemoteIp(127.0.0.1), Operation(User login), Roles(\n    a: r1, r2, r3\n), Status(Failed), Reason(Bad credentials), Consecutive failures(1)"
     got: "User(USER1), RemoteIp(127.0.0.1), Operation(User login), Roles(    a: r1, r2, r3), Status(Failed), Reason(Bad credentials), Consecutive failures(1)"

	at org.apache.ambari.server.audit.LoginAuditEventTest.testFailedAuditMessage(LoginAuditEventTest.java:118)

900026 [ERROR] testAuditMessage(org.apache.ambari.server.audit.LoginAuditEventTest)  Time elapsed: 0.001 s  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: 

Expected: "User(USER1), RemoteIp(127.0.0.1), Operation(User login), Roles(\n    a: r1, r2, r3\n), Status(Success)"
     got: "User(USER1), RemoteIp(127.0.0.1), Operation(User login), Roles(    a: r1, r2, r3), Status(Success)"

	at org.apache.ambari.server.audit.LoginAuditEventTest.testAuditMessage(LoginAuditEventTest.java:64)

900027 [ERROR] testFailedAuditMessageUnknownUser(org.apache.ambari.server.audit.LoginAuditEventTest)  Time elapsed: 0.002 s  <<< FAILURE!
java.lang.AssertionError: 

Expected: "User(USER1), RemoteIp(127.0.0.1), Operation(User login), Roles(\n    a: r1, r2, r3\n), Status(Failed), Reason(Bad credentials), Consecutive failures(UNKNOWN USER)"
     got: "User(USER1), RemoteIp(127.0.0.1), Operation(User login), Roles(    a: r1, r2, r3), Status(Failed), Reason(Bad credentials), Consecutive failures(UNKNOWN USER)"

	at org.apache.ambari.server.audit.LoginAuditEventTest.testFailedAuditMessageUnknownUser(LoginAuditEventTest.java:173)
```


Can you please work on this and make it success.
Assigned this to you.
Once done i will review the same.
